sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"连续的，不断的"之意。
means: continual ： 强调重复或持续发生，但连续之间允许有间断。
continuous ： 语意最强，强调在时间和空间上没有间断。
successive ： 强调事物一个接一个地发生，无间断。
constant ： 多指习惯性的重复和不变的持续。
persistent ： 普通用词，可指不懈的努力，也可指任何连续不断或重复出现的事物。

sentence.Network_en: Big credits were given to East Germany by successive West German governments.
sentence.Network_cn: 历届西德政府给予东德大量的贷款。

sentence.Network_en: It is necessary to distinguish the policies of two successive governments.
sentence.Network_cn: 分清前后两届政府的政策很有必要。

sentence.Network_en: Successive regimes annexed the region and populated it with lowland people.
sentence.Network_cn: 各继任政权吞并了该地区，并将低地的人们迁移到了这里。

Andrea paid no attention to the successive charges which were brought against him ., 安德烈听着维尔福起诉书中接连提出来的罪名.

人教版七年级上册英语单词表 ... new adj. 新的 successful adj. 成功的 weekend n. 周末.

... striker n. 足球（前锋） success n. 成就；成功 successfully adv. 圆满地；顺利地；成功地.

means.word_mean: 连续的,系列的,持续的,顺序的,直线的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from medieval Latin successivus, from success- 'followed closely', from the verb succedere (see succeed)

entry.def: Successive means happening or existing one after another without a break.

example.ex: Jackson was the winner for a second successive year...
example.tran: 杰克逊已经是连续第二年获胜了。

example.ex: Britain was suffering from the failure of successive governments to co-ordinate a national transport policy.
example.tran: 接连几届政府都没能协调出一个全国性的交通运输政策，英国因此而深受其苦。

auth_sentence.content: Three successive draws have frustrated O'Neill in this campaign.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Three successive draws have frustrated O'Neill in this campaign.

auth_sentence.content: Each successive vintage has also been sold for charity.
auth_sentence.res_content: Each successive vintage has also been sold for charity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Each successive vintage has also been sold for charity.

auth_sentence.content: Second, that successive governments usually give way to them.
auth_sentence.res_content: Second, that successive governments usually give way to them.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Second, that successive governments usually give way to them.

stems_affixes.word_buile: access[n.接近;入口 v.存取, 接近]+ible能……的→adj.能接近的;可进去的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
excess[n.过度,过剩]+ive……的→adj.过分的;过度的
in不+accessible[adj.能接近的;可进去的]→adj.难以接近的
suc随后+cess行走,前进+ive……的→随后跟上→连续的
access接近+ory表形容词或名词→接近的物→附加物,附属的
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+or人→走在前面的人→祖先
an=ante前+cest=cess行走,前进+ry整体→n.祖先;世系,家世
con共同+cess后退+ion动作或状态→n.让步;退位
ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ary物→n.必需品

stems_affixes.value_cn: 必要性, 需要,必需品
stems_affixes.word_buile: ne=need需要+cess行走,前进+ity性质,特性等→n.必要性, 需要,必需品
process[n.过程;进行 v.加工, 处理]+ion表名词→向前走的队伍
re回+cess行走,前进→走回去→休息
re回+cess行走,前进+ion动作或状态→走回去→撤退
suc随后+cess行走,前进→随后跟上→继续→继续做→成功
